intro: Dissocarpus biflorus var. cephalocarpus, commonly known as the crowned clusterpod, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its distinctive feature is the presence of a crown-like structure at the base of the inflorescence, giving it its common name. The species is known for its small, clustered flowers and is often found in dry, open habitats.
